concise_definition: v. 糟蹋, 胡搞, 干预, 搞乱 (为 mess 的现在分词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To make a mess of something by handling it carelessly or incompetently, often resulting in disorder or damage.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因粗心或无能地处理某物而导致混乱、凌乱或损坏。
definitions.example_en: Stop messing with the wiring—you could cause a short circuit!
definitions.example_cn: 别乱动电线了——你可能会造成短路！

definitions.explanation_en: To interfere or meddle in something that does not concern you, often in an annoying or disruptive way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 无端干涉或插手与自己无关的事情，通常带有令人厌烦或破坏性的意味。
definitions.example_en: He’s always messing around in other people’s business.
definitions.example_cn: 他总是爱插手别人的私事。

definitions.explanation_en: To waste time or act in a frivolous or aimless way, often without serious intent.
definitions.explanation_cn: 浪费时间或以轻率、无目的的方式行事，通常并无严肃意图。
definitions.example_en: They were just messing around in the backyard instead of doing their homework.
definitions.example_cn: 他们只是在后院瞎玩，而不是做作业。

comparison.analysis: “Fiddling”（摆弄）通常指轻微、琐碎地操作某物，常带有一种无害或无聊的意味，如“fiddling with a pen”。而 “messing” 更强调造成混乱或破坏的后果，语气更负面，范围更广。
“Interfering”（干涉）是更正式、更中性的词，指介入他人事务，不一定带有负面情绪。而 “messing” 在此语境下带有强烈贬义，暗示鲁莽、不专业或令人反感的介入。
“Screwing up” 是俚语，比 “messing” 更粗俗，强调彻底的失败或搞砸，常用于严重后果的场景（如“screwing up the presentation”）。而 “messing” 可轻可重，语境更灵活，有时仅指轻微混乱。
